strapiPost.title: Weekend Roundup
strapiPost.content:
Happy Friday everyone! Here are some things you might enjoy in NWA over the next few days:

  • Water watching: Grab your floaties, because tonight is the first drive-in movie of the season at the Wilson Park Pool.
  • Festivities: Attend the Freedom Fest 2022 in Pea Ridge on Sunday for some food, fun, and fireworks! 
  • Best Friends Pack Hike: Bring your furry friends on a fun group hike around Lake Fayetteville on Saturday morning. 
  • Wild rides: The annual Rodeo of the Ozarks is taking place today and tomorrow in Springdale.
  • Johnson Square: The second Johnson Square Summer Series event is tomorrow preceded by Pizza & Pilates on the Lawn!
  • On display: Mount Sequoyah is unveiling three new public art pieces on Saturday. Go give them a look!
  • Round 2: Core Brewing & Distilling Co. in Springdale is hosting the 2022 Arkansas SeltzerFest tomorrow all day. 
  • Free jams: Stop by Rogers for a great time at one of the Railyard Live concerts this weekend. 
  • Film screening: Spend the weekend checking out (in person or virtual), the Bentonville Film Festival.

Have a wonderful weekend, stay cool, and we'll see you Monday!
